value.title: Unleashing The Power Of A Diverse Team To Build More Ethical AI Technologies

value.title: AI brings promise and peril to customer relations management
value.excerpt: Keeping customers happy requires a lot of data, and CRM platforms are increasingly relying on AI to meet those expectations.

value.title: AI ethics expert: 'Half of companies using AI overestimate their level of maturity'
value.excerpt: Tonya Hall talks to Steven Mills, Chief AI Ethics Officer at Boston Consulting Group, about AI maturity, how to achieve it, and what sectors are doing it better.

value.title: How Finance Leaders Can Build An AI Culture
value.excerpt: Implementing AI across an organization requires a clear strategy, organizational flexibility, a data-driven environment and new forms of collaboration with cross-functional teams.

value.title: Ethics part of curriculum as Singapore inks AI training partnership with Google Cloud
value.excerpt: Participants of Singapore's artificial intelligence (AI) apprenticeship scheme have to go through training that includes ethics and governance, so they are aware of potential issues involving data bias. AI Singapore (AISG), which manages the apprenticeship ...

value.title: Ethical AI Is Easier Said Than Done, But We've Got to Start Somewhere
value.excerpt: AI has run amok and been benched in multiple business deployments. In one instance, an AI had to be shut off after it spewed outrageously lewd and racist comments within 16 hours of being launched because of data poisoning.

value.title: Sama Validates Its Ethical AI Supply Chain Through A Randomized Control Study With MIT

value.title: Analysis - 'Racist' facial recognition sparks ethical concerns in Russia
value.excerpt: The rise of facial recognition is accompanied by a growing chorus of concern about unethical uses of the technology.

value.title: DeepMind’s Scientist Sparks Fresh Debate Over AI Ethics
value.excerpt: Raia Hadsell, a researcher at DeepMind, appeared in a virtual tech summit to shed light on the ethics in the field of artificial intelligence.

value.title: AI legislation must address bias in algorithmic decision-making systems
value.excerpt: One promising bill proposes a cross-government investigation into discriminatory algorithmic processes throughout the economy.

value.title: Analysis-'Racist' facial recognition sparks ethical concerns in Russia
value.excerpt: From scanning residents’ faces to let them into their building to spotting police suspects in a crowd, the rise of facial recognition is accompanied by a growing chorus of concern about unethical uses of the technology.

value.title: AI-Driven Robots Are Here For Good
value.excerpt: AI, algorithms and technological applications are accelerating into new realms. With the proper implementation of ethics, diversity, and inclusive design - humans stand to benefit significantly.

value.title: The future of the AI-based enterprise
value.excerpt: Imagine an enterprise like a living organism that will naturally adapt based on the environment. Its products and services, will grow, shrink, defend, and heal themselves as needed. This is the future of the AI -based enterprise.

value.title: Adversa AI Red Team Introduces Technology for Ethical Hacking of Facial Recognition Systems
value.excerpt: The Adversa AI Red Team has performed a proof-of-concept attack on PimEyes, the most popular and advanced public picture face search engine. FREMONT, CA: Adversa AI, a trusted AI research leader, has presented a novel attack method for AI facial recognition applications.

value.title: Google Sold $2.5 Million In AI To The Pentagon For Its Covid-19 Recovery
value.excerpt: A previously-undisclosed deal with the Pentagon reveals Google sold AI tech for the DOD’s Covid-19 recovery. But, with no contractual “red line,” there were concerns it could have been repurposed for non-Covid military projects.

value.title: Study finds that few major AI research papers consider negative impacts
value.excerpt: A new research paper finds that values in the AI research field are centered around performance rather than inclusiveness.

value.title: Nice publishes ethical framework for applying AI to customer service
value.excerpt: Robotic process automation firm Nice published an ethical framework for applying AI and RPA to customer support functions.

value.title: Unesco agrees draft text for ethical AI
value.excerpt: After months of constructive dialogue and negotiation, representatives from UNESCO’s member states have agreed on the draft text of an ambitious and wide-ranging new template for the ethical development and deployment of Artificial Intelligence.

value.title: WHO outlines principles for ethics in health AI
value.excerpt: The World Health Organization released a guidance document outlining six key principles for the ethical use of artificial intelligence in health. Twenty experts spent two years developing the guidance,

value.title: Scaling Blue-Collar AI Ethically And Sustainably
value.excerpt: Developing an AI labor force is similar to building a pyramid. And the mortar holding the entire structure together is ethics.

value.title: Shenzhen, China’s Silicon Valley, plans to turbocharge local AI development with first-of-a-kind regulations
value.excerpt: Local government departments and state-owned companies will be required to take the lead in using AI products and services to boost implementation of the technology.

value.title: Industrial AI Is Here, But Is Your Organization Ready For It?
value.excerpt: This readiness checklist should be taken as more of a guidepost, rather than a one-size-fits-all prescription for making your organization AI-ready on day one.

value.title: The Uneasy Alliance Between Business Leaders And Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: AI is seen by many inside and outside the corporate world as a mysterious, dark art that only data scientists and algorithm developers can love.

value.title: WHO warns against applying AI models using data from rich countries to everyone else
value.excerpt: The World Health Organization wants to ensure that ethical considerations and human rights are the centre of any AI-based healthcare solutions.

value.title: Artificial Intelligence Hold Potential for Improving Delivery of Healthcare Worldwide: WHO
value.excerpt: Artificial Intelligence (AI) holds great promise for improving the delivery of healthcare and medicine worldwide.

value.title: Thailand’s Pomelo is revolutionizing SEA’s fashion industry with machine learning and AI
value.excerpt: Machine learning and AI have a multitude of applications in various industries, but fashion might sound like a curious one - Tech Wire Asia

value.title: The Linux Foundation is working to improve voice recognition ethics
value.excerpt: Last week, the Linux Foundation created a new open source industry association called the Open Voice Network (OVN). The new group is an independently governed directed fund of the Linux Foundation, with the goals of improving trust,
